channel.title: Daily Feed (Last 48 Hours, Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Last 48 Hours, Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: Death Comes to the Dictator
item.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei brought his country and regime to ruin.

item.title: Why the US attack on Iran is unlikely to produce regime change in Tehran
item.description: A conversation with veteran diplomat Donald Heflin, a leader at Tufts University's Fletcher School.

item.title: Iranian drones damage US Navy base in Bahrain; Americans evacuate
item.description: Retaliatory strikes damaged facilities at the home of the 5th Fleet headquarters.

item.title: Shahed drone meets clone in US war on Iran
item.description: The Feb. 28 strikes saw the first combat use of the LUCAS, a near-copy of Iran’s cheap and effective Shahed-136.

item.title: Strikes on Iran will test US cyber strategy abroad, and defenses at home
item.description: The federal government’s cyber defense agency is short-staffed, and Tehran is known for its retaliatory cyberattacks.

item.title: Iran Is Not Venezuela, Regime-Change Skeptics Warn
item.description: With Khamenei dead, Trump implores surviving leaders to lay down arms, accept amnesty, or die

item.title: Trump Says Iranian Supreme Leader Is Dead
item.description: Iran has not confirmed Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s death.

item.title: The Iranian Regime’s Existential Crisis—and What Might Come After Khamenei
item.description: A Conversation With Karim Sadjadpour

item.title: The Iranian Regime’s Existential Crisis—and What Might Come After Khamenei
item.description: A Conversation With Karim Sadjadpour

item.title: Trump Is Betraying His Base By Waging War on Iran
item.description: Voters were promised America First, not Bush-era interventions.

item.title: Expect Iranian regime to respond to US‑Israeli strikes as existential threats
item.description: The response to last year's strikes on nuclear sites was muted. Don't expect this one to be the same.

item.title: Gauging the Impact of Massive U.S.-Israeli Strikes on Iran
America’s Gulf allies face a moment of great peril
item.description: If war cannot be avoided, should they take sides?

item.title: 6 Questions About Operation Epic Fury
item.description: The United States and Israel have set a high bar for success in their war on Iran.

item.title: Iran’s Conflict With Israel and the United States
World Leaders, U.S. Lawmakers React to U.S. Strikes on Iran
item.description: Early views fell along ideological lines as the international community waits for damage reports.

item.title: Iran Is Built to Withstand the Ayatollah’s Assassination
item.description: The U.S. and Israeli militaries are targeting Iran’s leaders—but that may only strengthen the state.

item.title: Iran Is a Test of Trump’s National Defense Strategy
Oil Markets Brace for Disruption After U.S.-Israel Strikes on Iran
item.description: The worries include strikes against regional oil production as well as crude flows from the Persian Gulf.

item.title: What Are Iran’s Nuclear and Missile Capabilities?
The Islamic Republic’s Power Centers
Reflections on the Protests in Iran
America and Israel bomb Iran, aiming to topple its regime
item.description: Donald Trump calls on Iranians to rise up. War could quickly engulf the Middle East

item.title: U.S., Israel Begin ‘Major Combat Operations’ in Iran
item.description: “They’ve rejected every opportunity to renounce their nuclear ambitions, and we can’t take it anymore,” Trump said.

item.title: Donald Trump goes nuclear on Anthropic
item.description: Silicon Valley will be caught in the fallout

item.title: Donald Trump lashes out at Anthropic
item.description: Silicon Valley will suffer as a consequence

item.title: Rapid Reaction to US-Israeli Joint Strikes on Iran
item.description: Today's the US and Israel made a first strike at regime change in Iran, initiating a battle that is existential for Tehran's leadership. The shape of the conflict is being determined now, with much at stake across the Gulf.

item.title: US and Israeli Strikes on Iran: Military and Nuclear Proliferation Analyses
item.description: For regime change and the elimination of Iran’s nuclear programme through an air-only campaign, the US and Israel will have to contest with many unknowns.
